sentences.en: And a long - drawn procession of formidable names it was!
sentences.cn: 这一长串鼎鼎大名真吓人 啊 !

sentences.en: He fronted a formidable band of fighters.
sentences.cn: 他率领着一队可畏的斗士。

sentences.en: He has a formidable knowledge of English literature.
sentences.cn: 他有丰富的英国文学知识.

sentences.en: He is very formidable; How could anybody be so brave as to offend him?
sentences.cn: 他可厉害了, 谁惹得起他 呀 !

sentences.en: He was one of the most formidable intellects of his time.
sentences.cn: 他是他那时代的盖世奇才.

sentences.en: How formidable [ impossible ] the task is!
In debate he was a formidable opponent.
sentences.cn: 在辩论中他是位难应付的对手。

sentences.en: Marsalis has a formidable reputation in both jazz and classical music.
sentences.cn: 马萨利斯在爵士乐和古典音乐领域都有极高的声望。

sentences.en: Mr. Smith had formidable opposition to the proposal.
sentences.cn: 史密斯先生强烈反对该建议.

sentences.en: She looked every bit as formidable as her mother.
sentences.cn: 她看上去和她母亲一样，令人望而生畏。

sentences.en: Spain ran England ragged early on but goalkeeper Ian Walker proved a formidable barrier.
sentences.cn: 西班牙队先是猛烈进攻，使英格兰队疲于奔命，但守门员伊恩·沃克防守甚严。

sentences.en: The building is grey, formidable, not at all picturesque.
sentences.cn: 那幢建筑呈灰色，气势凛然，与漂亮沾不上边。

sentences.en: the formidable task of local government reorganization
sentences.cn: 重组地方政府的艰巨任务

sentences.en: The new range of computers have formidable processing power.
sentences.cn: 该系列的新型计算机处理能力惊人。

sentences.en: They are too evenly matched, and their natural defences are too formidable.
sentences.cn: 它们都势均力敌, 天堑一般的防御条件不可逾越.

sentences.en: They possess a formidable arsenal of rifles, machine guns, landmines and teargas.
sentences.cn: 他们持有的步枪、机枪、地雷和催泪弹数量惊人。
这是一种很利害的手段.

words.tran_cn: 强大地；难对付地；可怕地
困难的;可畏的;令人敬畏的

trans.tran_cn: 可怕的，令人敬畏的，难以对付的
trans.tran_en: very powerful or impressive, and often frightening
